Name.label: Mendelian susceptibility to mycobacterial diseases due to complete IFNgammaR2 deficiency
Autosomal recessive mendelian susceptibility to mycobacterial diseases due to a complete deficiency

TextSection.Contents: Mendelian susceptibily to mycobacterial diseases (MSMD) due to complete interferon gamma receptor 2 (IFN-gammaR2) deficiency is a genetic variant of MSMD (see this term) characterized by a complete deficiency in IFN-gammaR2, leading to an undetectable response to IFN-gamma, and consequently, to severe and often fatal infections with bacillus Calmette-GuÃ©rin (BCG) and other environmental mycobacteria (EM).

Name.label: NTBT (narrower term maps to a broader term)
